smarty.metrics module¶

Note

Each metric from there requires both y and y_pred as np.ndarray and returns calculated score

smarty.metrics.accuracy(y, y_pred)[source]¶

Accuracy score

smarty.metrics.confusion_matrix(y, y_pred, return_classes=False)[source]¶

Calculates confusion matrix based on y and y_pred and returns it

Parameters:

return_classes (bool) – wheather or not to return class names

Returns:

conf_matrix if return_classes=False, otherwise (conf_matrix, classes)

smarty.metrics.f1_score(y, y_pred)[source]¶

F1 score, only for binary classifier

smarty.metrics.mean_squared_error(y, y_pred)[source]¶

Mean squared error score

smarty.metrics.precision(y, y_pred)[source]¶

Precision score, only for binary classifier

smarty.metrics.r_squared(y, y_pred)[source]¶

R squared score

smarty.metrics.recall(y, y_pred)[source]¶

Recall score, only for binary classifier

smarty.metrics.root_mean_squared_error(y, y_pred)[source]¶

Root mean squared error score
